data.title: Cute Winery in Historic District
data.text: They are a cute little custom winery that makes all their wines on premise in their cellar. It's in one of the historic buildings just down the street from Naegelin's Bakery (also worth a stop). The staff is very friendly. We had a tasting took home a bottle of the South African Chenin Blanc. I was very impressed with the range of wines. They had wines I'd never even heard of before. Definitely worth a stop when in New Braunfels.

data.title: Great place
data.text: I've drank there, listened to live music, played live music there. Awesome owners, great location, wonderful product. Will visit every time I'm close.

data.title: Nice Experience
data.text: Nice little wine tasting experience. They have a large selection of wines and the staff was very friendly.

data.title: Great for a Chain
data.text: All wine is made on premises!  Made from juice.  The wines are delicious!  The wines have the least amount of sulfites-- more than any other winery that I am aware of.  Because of this, the wines are not, bitter but mellow.  The server was knowledgeable.  We ended up buying a bottle if the Diablo Roja and the Italian Amarone.  Definitely recommend this place if you are in this area.

data.title: Nice Place
data.text: Nice quaint place in the middle of town.  The wine was good and the tastings were free.  The workers were friendly and knowledgeable.  The wine was reasonable and worth taking home.  They had a large variety of fruit infused wine in many different flavors.

data.title: Good variety
data.text: The idea is great but the management is rude to the point that I wont go back.....  I felt that i was looked down at... ( little did they know I know my wines better than some vitners...)   Heads up, not customer service at its best

data.title: Great, even if you HATE wine!
data.text: These people are PROs!! I'm not a fan of wine and they made me into a believer! I told her I like grape juice and the woman behind the counter pulled out four samples of wine that were a tastier version of the grade juice I'm happy with. They know what they're doing in that joint and now it's the only place I buy wine for myself and for presents! Great for a date or just to pick up a Christmas present!

data.title: Lots of Selection!
data.text:
You have to try this place. If you like wine, you will have a lot to choose from in your tasting. The owner is a retired teacher that loves to talk about wine if she is working. The other waitstaff is also knowledgeable about wine and ready to help you with your selection.

We like to visit the farmer's market first and take in some of our purchases to eat while tasting wine. You can bring your dinner there! Lots of creativity went into this place.

data.title: Not a great experience.
data.text: I recently visited this establishment with a group of girlfriends.  Although we were the only patrons in the place, we did not feel welcome.  The woman serving us was impatient and pushy, as though we were wasting her time by being there.  We drank a glass of wine and left as soon as we could.

data.title: Great fun
data.text: We had two cases of our very own wine mix, and our own labels. These are great to share with friends  or to be given as gifts. The whole process is great fun and educational.

data.title: A great experience
data.text: This was a comfortable, classy place to taste wine before purchasing it. The owners bring samples according to your preferences, discuss each wine, provide a way for you to remember all that you tried -- and then you can purchase the ones you preferred. Even if you have never paid too much attention to the various characteristics of wine, they help you become much more knowledgeable. The wines are delicious and free of chemicals that can have unwanted side effects. You feel as though you have made new friends, too, after you go there for a first visit. I know I want to return. It is probably not a place for a family with small children, but the teen who was with us enjoyed herself.
